revised_title: Internal Conversion of Beta-Rays: A Quantum Mechanics Approach
tldr: The authors investigate the internal conversion of beta-rays in atoms using quantum mechanics. They find that the calculated values are about one-eighth smaller than experimental values, but the discrepancy is likely due to the neglect of the screening effect of other electrons. The theory can be applied to beta-absorption and may be improved by considering the change of the atomic field with the electron's energy.
